Please refer to https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-dependencies for setting up a spark job to process the dependencies.

Dear Bas Van Beek,

In setting up spark job that you have provided on GitHub. I have tried to
set it up on my own, but I am having some difficulties and I do not fully
understand the project.

I have reviewed the instructions on the project's GitHub page, but I am
still having trouble getting it up and running. I believe that I may be
missing some key information or steps.

I would greatly appreciate it if you could provide me with some guidance on
how to properly set up the project. Specifically, I would appreciate any
additional information or step-by-step instructions that you may have.

I believe that with your assistance, I will be able to make progress.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to hearing back
from you soon.

Best regards,
Hab Sal

@paweloque I see on your screenshots the same problem that I'm currently trying to solve. It is an "unknown" span name. Could you answer me, if you know, what is the reason for this? Is this a zipkin's bug or wrong code?

I think that the "unknown" is just a missing name for the span or something like reading from a queue. This is a minor problem and my major problem is that the other main parts from other processors (distributed parts) are not visible at all (even though they are in the data). Do you have the same problem @NatalyaAlexinskaya ?
@paweloque Not the same. Sometimes some spans have an "unknown" name, sometimes it is displayed correctly.

Update from my side. I was testing more of the functionality and realized that ignoring the array value in the tags is not what should happen. Instead I changed it so that it parses the array so that it can be viewable in the tags. Now I can see the array value in the tags but the value is not searchable. For example, if I have `tags: { ids: [1, 2, 3]}` I won't be able to search for 1, 2, or 3 by providing the query `_q: id=1` or `_q: id=2` or `_q: id=3`. None of these would return results with the fix I made. So I looked deeper and though to change the Map value type for the `annotationQuery` to type Object. This is so it can have a type array returned when calling the method `parseAnnotationQuery` in the class `QueryRequest`. Changing the map value type required me to change it in several files to get it to compile. But after all that it is still not searchable even though I provide the value as an array when returning from `parseAnnotationQuery`. Any ideas on what else I need to change to get this working so I can search multiple value fields for any tag?

Because the same version can cause conflicts, but I currently see the modification to version 0.7.0. I don't need to modify it again
I think the issue is we should add a `version: x.x.x-snapshot` or disable version checking by using ` --check-version-increment=false`. Any input @jonkerj ?

@llinder  @shakuzen @jcchavezs Need a bit help understanding what this 1 test failure is about as I didn't see while building for zipkin-server on top of latest [2.24.1](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/releases/tag/2.24.1) ([5e3402a](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/commit/5e3402a5dbed07b8e4ae259963937dd74c5a5c58)) release locally

It is very uncommon to template namespace from values, I'd recommend using `{{ .Release.Namespace }}` instead (which is very common practise). Any reason why you specifically want to sort of hardcode this from the values, @mfordjody?

As for the version/snapshot: if the chart version is CI'd during release, I'd agree with using snapshot/git refs for non-release, @jcchavezs.

> It is very uncommon to template namespace from values, I'd recommend using `{{ .Release.Namespace }}` instead (which is very common practise). Any reason why you specifically want to sort of hardcode this from the values, @mfordjody?
> 
> As for the version/snapshot: if the chart version is CI'd during release, I'd agree with using snapshot/git refs for non-release, @jcchavezs.

good idea

@darkmastermindz thanks for opening the pull request and sorting out the SnakeYAML issue. So far the tests run locally for me as well but I will see if I can track down the problem when running on GH.

Much better. I would still personally prefer not using the define, and template `{{ .Release.Namespace }}` everywhere (it's what all major charts do), unless you really want to support the (IMO unlikely) scenario that the helm release lives in namespace A whereas the templated resources go into B. It may be a matter of taste, though. I'm a big fan of reducing complexity 😄

I was able to reproduce it when debugging. I think what is happening is that the application startup times are triggering it: `application_ready_time_seconds{main_application_class="zipkin2.server.internal.prometheus.ITZipkinMetrics",} 2.548`

My assumption is that `.doesNotContain("prometheus")` catches the server start metric, which in this case has `prometheus` in the package name. When running locally it could be that the metric just doesn't make it into the registry before the test completes. Probably what we wan't to check instead is `.doesNotContain("uri=\"/prometheus")`.

Hi I'm raising this question rather than create a new feature request since it looks like it is in the same area. Apologies if this is the wrong place.

I am trying to integrate zipkin into a RabbitMQ configured with **Mutual TLS**. The above describes some updated support where zipkin uses the dummy 'trust everything' TrustManager, which is fine. My problem is that the current approach, I think, is hard coded to set up a dummy/empty KeyStore.

This means that our RabbitMQ rejects the connection because it doesn't see an acceptable client certificate coming from Zipkin client.

Is it possible to update the ZipkinRabbitMQCollectorProperties or equivalent to optionally create an SSLContext that uses the dummy trust manager, but allows a 'real' KeyStore to be configured?  and then call connectionFactory.useSslProtocol, specifying the SSLContext just created? Or some other mechaism to allow a KeyStore to be injected?

I tried setting JAVA_OPTS to default to a keystore file, but it is just ignored by the hard-coded logic

If there is another approach or workaround already in use I'd be grateful to hear about it
@jcchavezs @llinder @shakuzen Could you help with fixing this failing test?
I would really love to see this happening in lens cc @tacigar @wu-sheng @basvanbeek

Please use this link https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/security/advisories/new, also if you are up to, could you create a `SECURITY.md` file like in https://github.com/corazawaf/coraza/blob/main/SECURITY.md ?
Could you please rebase to include this change? https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/1acbc8651df50aa8200cbff725285a1cb1c759d9/.github/ct.yml
I'm all for it, ideally we'd allow themes so we can bring back a dark theme too like we had in the initial design for lens (ideal for those late night troubleshooting sessions).

The colors of services are not going to cover the whole row. And a small icon indicates entry or exit spans, in Zipkin, it means producer or consumer.
